subject: Re: [junit] Testing Asynchronous Methods??
msgSnippet: If at all possible, make your unit tests single threaded. Use mock objects for listeners ( http://www.jmock.org ). If your test really has to be multithreaded,
messageBody:
If at all possible, make your unit tests single threaded.
Use mock objects for listeners ( http://www.jmock.org ).
If your test really has to be multithreaded, use the util.concurrent channel classes (now part of java 5) to post events back to the testing thread where you can make assertions.
Don't use Thread.sleep. That would make your tests slow and fragile.

- Neil
